update.description:
* need [this pull request from gazebo_models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff)
* redo pull request #2010 without the `keyhit` detector containing LGPL code
* ~~Need [this pull request for models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff).~~
* Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin. Controlled cessna flight by adding lift drag plugin response to control surface joint (cl only for now)
* change drag and re-orient sensor data before sending out to SIM_Gazebo
* use actual rotor speed by reducing rotorVelocitySlowdownSim from 10 to 1, and got rid of vertical and yaw coupling by adjusting cla and cda.
* [video](https://youtu.be/n_M5Vs5FBGY)
update.title: Aerodynamic updates

content.raw:
None of the 4 worlds are loading for me. `plane_demo`, `plane_propeller_demo` and `quad_rotor_demo` print errors and just hang in the terminal, gzclient doesn't even come up:

~~~
louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/plane_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model
~~~

~~~
louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/quad_rotor_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_1_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_2_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_3_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_4_joint
Error [Element.cc:684] Missing element description for [control]
~~~

~~~
louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/plane_propeller_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_1_joint
~~~

And the iris world opens gzclient but the screen stays black...

Am I just not waiting long enough? I checked that I have the correct models from the gazebo_models PR.
content.html:
None of the 4 worlds are loading for me. plane_demo, plane_propeller_demo and quad_rotor_demo print errors and just hang in the terminal, gzclient doesn't even come up:

louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/plane_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model

louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/quad_rotor_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_1_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_2_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_3_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_4_joint
Error [Element.cc:684] Missing element description for [control]

louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/plane_propeller_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_1_joint

And the iris world opens gzclient but the screen stays black...

Am I just not waiting long enough? I checked that I have the correct models from the gazebo_models PR.

content.raw:
There is no error handling if there is not "engine" element. Maybe we want to throw a warning or even a failure?

Same applies for thruster and control blocks below.
content.html:
There is no error handling if there is not "engine" element. Maybe we want to throw a warning or even a failure?

Same applies for thruster and control blocks below.

content.raw: debug message to be removed or transformed to gzdbg?
content.html: debug message to be removed or transformed to gzdbg?

content.raw: debug message to be removed or transformed to gzdbg?
content.html: debug message to be removed or transformed to gzdbg?

content.raw: commented block about orientation. Again not sure if it useful or should be removed.
content.html: commented block about orientation. Again not sure if it useful or should be removed.

content.raw: do we want to leave this block commented for some reason?
content.html: do we want to leave this block commented for some reason?

content.raw: Looks like we could get a 0 in `this->rotors[i].rotorVelocitySlowdownSim`coming from user configuration. Check here or in the rotor class if it can never be 0.
content.html: Looks like we could get a 0 in this->rotors[i].rotorVelocitySlowdownSimcoming from user configuration. Check here or in the rotor class if it can never be 0.

content.raw: `cw` or `cww` are the options and the message says that default is `1` we probably want to change 1 by ccw
content.html: cw or cww are the options and the message says that default is 1 we probably want to change 1 by ccw

content.raw: if there is no linkname here, a `gzerr` is used and probably the next check of rotor.link will fail because there we are using an empty link name. Looks safer to me to throw here instead of leaving the `GetLink()` to be called using an empty string.
content.html: if there is no linkname here, a gzerr is used and probably the next check of rotor.link will fail because there we are using an empty link name. Looks safer to me to throw here instead of leaving the GetLink() to be called using an empty string.

content.raw:
This method seems to be [deprecated in gazebo 8.0](https://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/dev/classgazebo_1_1event_1_1Events.html#a7377743aa9b027374ced09c8c6a58fad).

Another detail: we are calling the event method in the destructor but this->updateConnection is setup in the `init()` method and not in the constructor. In a run with only constructor + destructor, would this be safe? has it fully sense?
content.html:
This method seems to be deprecated in gazebo 8.0.

Another detail: we are calling the event method in the destructor but this->updateConnection is setup in the init() method and not in the constructor. In a run with only constructor + destructor, would this be safe? has it fully sense?

content.raw: probably is a good idea to check the return value and handle the error if any
content.html: probably is a good idea to check the return value and handle the error if any
